instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
only greenlight  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.25v using 85w fake charger.
j6950 scl/sda 3.4v
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 17-18 3.5ohms 27-28 21.1ohms
1. 0v
2. 16.2v
3. 3.9v
9. 0v
12. 3.4v
13. 3.4v
14. 3.3v
15. 0v
17. 12.25v
19. 5v
20. 5v
25. 16.5v
27.  16.1v
previously replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> cause <SIGNAL>CHRG_PHASE</SIGNAL> is shorted also replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Do you get green light on Magsafe with original charger?
If not, replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
i got green light on orig 60w charger 
tried replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Post voltage and diode mode for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Check w/ and w/o BIL connected (J6955).
If no good, remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
SCL 0.521ohms 3.4v stable
SDA 0.502ohms 0v-3.4v looping with/without <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>

w/ and w/o BIL nothing changes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
You should get less than 1% difference between both lines; in diode mode.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6952</CAPACITOR>/53 and test again.
If still the same, change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
SMC is the last option.

BTW, battery should be removed...
